meanings.definition: The act of corrupting or degrading something
meanings.sent1: The bastardization of the once beautiful painting left it unrecognizable.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to cut corners led to the bastardization of the product's quality.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the bastardization of his favorite childhood cartoon characters.
meanings.sent4: The rapid industrialization brought about a bastardization of the natural landscape.
meanings.sent5: The gradual bastardization of the traditional recipe resulted in a dish no one recognized.

meanings.definition: The process of making something impure or inferior
meanings.sent1: The gradual bastardization of the water source led to health concerns in the community.
meanings.sent2: The constant exposure to pollutants caused the bastardization of the air quality in the city.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rainstorm resulted in the bastardization of the outdoor wedding plans.
meanings.sent4: The unchecked spread of misinformation led to the bastardization of public trust in the media.
meanings.sent5: The introduction of artificial flavors caused the bastardization of the natural taste of the fruit.
